result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Lee White #477888 was found guilty of OWI (7th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Lee White #477888 was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Lee White #477888 was found guilty of Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).
  • Lee White #477888 was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Lee  White in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Defendant Lee  White in custody.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PSI examined by all parties.  Attny Bennett indicates some clarifications/corrections.  Defendant's daughter and fiance make statements on defendant's behalf.  Arguments as to penalty.  Court orders on Ct. 1- 8 1/2 yrs (3 1/2 conf. + 5 ES) with conditions.  Counts 2,3 & 4 jail sentence + fines and costs.  WEDS and notice of voting ineligibility provided. Not eligible for CIP, is eligible for ERP.

Sentencing hearing on August 9, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant knowingly & voluntarily entered into his pleas on 1/13/16.  Defense counsel did not observe at that time that the defendant seemed intoxicated and because of his long term issues  with alcohol could function normally with a .10 alcohol level.  Court questions defendant directly about his ability to understand the day of the plea hearing.  Collequey given, both counsel and defendant states he understood what he was doing.  Court accepts said plea.  DA would like at least 2 weeks from the point an alternative PSI is given by defense so our local P&P Agent can review.

Defendant Lee  White in court with attorney Lindsay L Erickson.  Defendant Lee  White in custody.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests additional time for their pre-sentence report.  Sentencing date of 2/25 will be used as a review of plea date.
